revised_title: Observations of the Total Solar Eclipse of 1868 along the Borneo Coast
tldr: During the total solar eclipse of August 18th, 1868, along the coast of Borneo, J. Pope Hennessy observed and documented the beautiful and unique phenomena that occurred, such as the rose-colored and blue protuberances on the sun's limb. These observations were made possible by the collaboration with Capt. Reed, who determined the exact longitude of Barram Point. The detailed account of the event and the meteorological observations taken during the eclipse are shared with the scientific community.
